attributes.action: Reduce the burden of cost for planning applications
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The planning system needs to be made simpler and less costly.  The fee in submitting an application is £350 for one dwelling the same building if split internally into 4 dwellings is subjected to a multiple fee 4x.  An imbalance as the work involved by planning authorities is not 4x.
The COST of preparation for planning applications is excessive in time and monetary.
A single application through the consultation process (if your lucky enough to get a council that will participate) can take months even years, with survey reports being requested months down the line instead of at the beginning of the process, creating further delays.
A recent development proposal for 10 flats designed to provide; Low-Cost Private Sector housing for Single People, according to ALL government and external sources desperately needed, 12 months of consultations, £30,000 in a variety of survey reports and still no guarantee the scheme will obtain planning consent.  A scheme designed to provide low-cost housing, if the planning system is not overhauled to reduce the cost burden then, the private sector is going to be unable to provide the dwellings.
